text: Bourgtheroulde-Infreville () is a former commune in the Eure department in Normandy in northern France. It is the seat of the commune of Grand- Bourgtheroulde. ==History== The Battle of Bourgthéroulde was fought between English loyalist and Norman rebels in 1124. On 1 January 2016, Bosc-Bénard- Commin, Bourgtheroulde-Infreville and Thuit-Hébert merged, becoming one commune called Grand-Bourgtheroulde.Arrêté préfectoral 9 December 2015 ==Population== ==See also== *Communes of the Eure department ==References== ==External links== *Official site Category:Former communes of Eure
title: Bourgtheroulde-Infreville
